eject.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to make someone leave a place or building by using force
eject.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The demonstrators were ejected from the hall.
eject.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to make someone leave a job or position very quickly
eject.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: 420 workers have been ejected from their jobs with no warning.
eject.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Two engines cut out and the plane started to eject fuel as it lost height.
eject.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: if a pilot ejects, he or she escapes from a plane, using an ejector seat because it is going to crash
eject.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if you eject a disk or a tape, or if it ejects, it comes out of a machine after you have pressed a particular button
